snippet: The United States and China should both be able to meet the stated goals by aggressively pursuing policies that are largely underway, analysts said.
abstract: Analysts say that historic climate agreement reached between United States and China does not signal major shift in policies by either nation, and that both should be able to meet stated goals by aggressively pursuing policies that are already in place.

byline.original: By HENRY FOUNTAIN and JOHN SCHWARTZ
byline.contributor: Edward Wong, Coral Davenport and Justin Gillis contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The United States and China should both be able to meet the stated goals by aggressively pursuing policies that are largely underway, analysts said.

headline.main: Climate Accord Relies on Environmental Policies Now in Place
headline.print_headline: Climate Accord Relies on Environmental Policies Now in Place

keywords.value: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change
keywords.name: subject
